H0.text: where is nuclear energy used most in the world. United States

H1.text: where is nuclear energy used most in the world. China

H2.text: where is nuclear energy used most in the world. Japan

H3.text: where is nuclear energy used most in the world. France

A4.text: The United States is the world's largest producer of commercial nuclear power, and in 2013 generated 33% of the world's nuclear electricity.

A5.text: In the United States, nuclear power is provided by 94 commercial reactors with a net capacity of 97 gigawatts (GW), with 63 pressurized water reactors and 31 boiling water reactors.
